item.title: Fractal dimension, and the problems traps of its estimation
item.description: arXiv:2406.19885v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: This chapter deals with error and uncertainty in data. Treats their measuring methods and meaning. It shows that uncertainty is a natural property of many data sets. Uncertainty is fundamental for the survival os living species, Uncertainty of the "chaos" type occurs in many systems, is fundamental to understand these systems.
item.dc:creator: Carlos Sevcik
